body:
I requested the installation of Maven 3.5.2 on Beam7:

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/INFRA-15907

When writing these lines runners where all java based so java build path was shorter than other languages which were just bridges to java. Not sure it is still the case but having mono language "build views" is important to keep being "contributable". Inded I care more of java but it is true for all languages I think.

We can close this PR if gradle makes it smoother - theorically yes but didnt get time to check to be honest.
Run Python Dataflow ValidatesContainer
Run Python Dataflow ValidatesContainer

from my comments en the previous PR:
- on asynchronous batch write:

> producer.addUserRecord is asynchronous call which adds record the queue which then will be grouped into batches and send to backend in background (Kinesis producer forks native processes to do this job). So, this is a responsibility of KPL in this case. Client can change number of records per batch with producer property (see withProducerProperties()).
> 
> What kind of cache mechanism do you mean?

The behavior you describe looks good to me

- on the assertEquals for with...

> IMHO it makes sense to test that with... works as expected.

I is equivalent to testing autovalue which is already tested. No other IO test that

retest this please
retest this please

Is it the right approach? My argument is that `filesToStage` should be marked with `@JsonIgnore` since it's not really needed at the worker side. If that is or isn't the case, looking at the FlinkPipelineOptions, `getStateBackend()` is marked `@JsonIgnore` and it sounds like if I wanted to run tests with a different backend then that wouldn't be doable from my test parameters because of this problem (or if I used a non-Java SDK, I could never be able to set the backend through parameters since my arguments would always be serialized away).

Edit: I understand for portability that serialization need to occur so I would say if the goal is portability then the `@JsonIgnore` should disappear entirely.
retest this please
It looks like this has acquired some conflicts and is quite old. Are you still working on this one, or could it be closed for now?
Since development here, we've started migrating to Gradle. This same functionality might be handy in a Gradle task of some sort. Are you planning on working on this any more?
Are you still planning to build this here?
Sorry if I took long to review, have totally missed it before.
retest this please

with some commentary --- Reviewed 7 of 7 files at r1. Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 2 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed. --- *[runners/core-construction-java/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/core/construction/Environments.java, line 105 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4469#-L3iNibk7znNUBdYir0o:-L3iNibk7znNUBdYir0p:b-viscwt) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/346e872a319849d522bae5a1908666f6d5b288e2/runners/core-construction-java/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/core/construction/Environments.java#L105)):* > ```Java > } > > private static String flattenExtractor(PTransform transform) { > ``` Probably just return Optional and none here --- *[runners/core-construction-java/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/core/construction/WindowingStrategyTranslation.java, line 213 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4469#-L3iOernRWaT9lra6iPt:-L3iOernRWaT9lra6iPu:bh8dr3s) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/346e872a319849d522bae5a1908666f6d5b288e2/runners/core-construction-java/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/core/construction/WindowingStrategyTranslation.java#L213)):* > ```Java > */ > public static SdkFunctionSpec toProto(WindowFn windowFn, SdkComponents components) { > // TODO: The environment may not be required for known WindowFns, but can always just be ignored > ``` A runner is not _required_ to implement the known WindowFns, so you still need an environment. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4469#-:-L3iOvOdS7zQJJMqaBr2:bt1e9ka)*

@JsonIgnore seems like the wrong annotation to use to distinguish between
values that are used by the runner vs. the workers, especially as the
options may have to be serialized to even make it to the runner. If this
distinction is important, we could add yet another annotation, though I'm
not sure it's worth its weight (there's little harm in passing the full
configuration to the workers even if part of it is ignored).

On Thu, Jan 25, 2018 at 6:52 AM, Paul Gerver <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Is it the right approach? My argument is that filesToStage should be
> marked with @JsonIgnore since it's not really needed at the worker side.
> If that is or isn't the case, looking at the FlinkPipelineOptions,
> getStateBackend() is marked @JsonIgnore and it sounds like if I wanted to
> run tests with a different backend then that wouldn't be doable from my
> test parameters because of this problem (or if I used a non-Java SDK, I
> could never be able to set the backend through parameters since my
> arguments would be serialized away).
>
> 
> You are receiving this because you commented.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/4478#issuecomment-360489240>, or mute
> the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAdqgRoo1T-uCR5YiLXnaHALdZaVSpbBks5tOJVHgaJpZM4RreDS>
> .
>
@jkff Thank you for review, I added some comments and questions.

Sorry for the slow reply. In fact the Jenkins jobs are built from the groovy files most recent on `master`. We don't have a way to do it differently, yet. That is https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-3047.

On this branch, you can add the runner to the `jenkins-precommit` profile. But quite soon we will move all of this to Gradle. Then you will need to change the gradle files on the branch.

This is great. It could certainly use some more tests in `DoFnSignaturesTest` and eventually `ParDoTest`. --- Reviewed 7 of 7 files at r1. Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 7 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed. --- *[sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/DoFn.java, line 603 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4482#-L3iXKNppHMuvM7OcR5x:-L3iXKNq3BUR2O5zK4d-:bfi6am4) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/e0189797ea0c0f51bf1b4da92029c83273b4aee9/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/DoFn.java#L603)):* > ```Java > * > *

Annotation that may be added to a {@link ProcessElement}, {@link OnTimer}, or > * {@link OnWindowExpiration} method to indicate that the runner must ensure that the observable > ``` Very nice noticing that it needs mention here. --- *[sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/reflect/ByteBuddyDoFnInvokerFactory.java, line 384 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4482#-L3iXbloaqbNOG_zWiEy:-L3iXbloaqbNOG_zWiEz:b-agsy5t) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/e0189797ea0c0f51bf1b4da92029c83273b4aee9/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/reflect/ByteBuddyDoFnInvokerFactory.java#L384)):* > ```Java > > /** Delegates method with extra parameters to the given method if available, or does nothing. */ > private static Implementation delegateMethodWithExtraParametersOrNoop( > ``` Also nice understanding that this is a new kind of method - it is optional like the lifecycle methods but accepts automated parameters. --- *[sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/reflect/ByteBuddyDoFnInvokerFactory.java, line 519 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4482#-L3iY2Vk_4-EeWOhfAm3:-L3iY2Vk_4-EeWOhfAm4:bc3ka4e) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/e0189797ea0c0f51bf1b4da92029c83273b4aee9/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/reflect/ByteBuddyDoFnInvokerFactory.java#L519)):* > ```Java > * "target method" of the wrapped {@link DoFn}. > */ > static class DoFnMethodWithExtraParametersDelegation extends DoFnMethodDelegation { > ``` Nice refactor here, too. --- *[sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/reflect/ByteBuddyDoFnInvokerFactory.java, line 697 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4482#-L3iYPljK2NAnAQJrQ9O:-L3iYPljK2NAnAQJrQ9P:biww5m0) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/e0189797ea0c0f51bf1b4da92029c83273b4aee9/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/reflect/ByteBuddyDoFnInvokerFactory.java#L697)):* > ```Java > */ > private static final class ProcessElementDelegation extends > DoFnMethodWithExtraParametersDelegation { > ``` It looks like we can almost delete `ProcessElementDelegation`. Incidentally, crashing on load as it happens below in the `static` block can really confuse tools that may actually surface `ClassNotFound` errors instead of the actionable error message. Instead we should make it lazy. Just a side comment. --- *[sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/reflect/DoFnSignatures.java, line 107 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4482#-L3iYt9wavKJ6GelHhC_:-L3iYt9wavKJ6GelHhCa:bokr0g5) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/e0189797ea0c0f51bf1b4da92029c83273b4aee9/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/reflect/DoFnSignatures.java#L107)):* > ```Java > ALLOWED_ON_WINDOW_EXPIRATION_PARAMETERS = > ImmutableList.of( > // TODO: Add support for OnWindowExpirationContextParameter. > ``` Maybe we can avoid introducing such a thing if we work on the specific pieces of the context that are needed. I think an `OutputReceiver` or some such is the only thing you need. For a long time we have wanted to separate that and eliminate context parameters - because they are just collections of other parameters anyhow, and redundant with the way that DoFn supports a mixed bag of parameters. --- *[sdks/java/core/src/test/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/reflect/OnWindowExpirationInvokerTest.java, line 62 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4482#-L3iZJAr0xw2SsPqYZTd:-L3iZJAr0xw2SsPqYZTe:bex1ol1) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/e0189797ea0c0f51bf1b4da92029c83273b4aee9/sdks/java/core/src/test/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/reflect/OnWindowExpirationInvokerTest.java#L62)):* > ```Java > > SimpleTimerDoFn fn = new SimpleTimerDoFn(); > DoFnInvoker invoker = DoFnInvokers.invokerFor(fn); > ``` I think this test looks like it could go in `DoFnInvokersTest` since it basically tests that a proper invoker was created. --- *[sdks/java/core/src/test/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/reflect/OnWindowExpirationInvokerTest.java, line 64 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4482#-L3iZO9XdLlCdYIuqi_r:-L3iZO9XdLlCdYIuqi_s:bgd0gth) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/e0189797ea0c0f51bf1b4da92029c83273b4aee9/sdks/java/core/src/test/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/reflect/OnWindowExpirationInvokerTest.java#L64)):* > ```Java > DoFnInvoker invoker = DoFnInvokers.invokerFor(fn); > > invoker.invokeOnWindowExpiration(mockArgumentProvider); > ``` You don't really need a mock, since it is a POJO. I think either way the default/stub/mock should already be set up in `DoFnInvokersTest`. Or maybe those methods are in ByteBuddyDoFnInvokerFactoryTest, which covers the same logic since `DoFnInvokers` right now just delegates to it. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4482#-:-L3iZd3FYhfkp9VukC8_:b-hzgnuz)*

There are reasons why a user my actually want to know what files were staged and this could be one way for them to get it. The original reason why it was marked with `@JsonIgnore` was because of a test infrastructure limitation in Dataflow 1.x. I would prefer to have as few options as possible marked with `@JsonIgnore` so users don't need to treat PipelineOptions differently during construction vs execution.

r:@herohde r:@lostluck
LGTM. Noting that this test has never passed and should probably just be deleted. So I am merging without trying it out through the seed job or anything.
@jbonfre and @jkff any chance this one and the other recent Cassandra issues gets merged and included in 2.3.0, looks quite important IMO.
I tested with a local Cassandra instance. So, for me it's OK even if I should have added a specific test. It's up to @jkff

JB - did you confirm that the test not only runs, but also uses more than 1 split? Because from the original StackOverflow issue, there were 3 bugs:

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-3424
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-3425
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-3485

And the current PR addresses only 1 of them but I believe all 3 need to be addressed in order to get proper splitting. It may be advisable to also add an explicit option for number of splits in case it can't be estimated for whatever reason (I think this falls under the rule of thumb "if not providing the parameter can be catastrophically bad in some cases").

This is really nice IMO. You even made the tests more readable :-). Most of it I am happy to merge right away. The main thing that I would not merge is the bit where you have a `CustomCoder` with a URN in it. Is that required right now? Let's sort out how Java coder <-> proto coder is going to work. --- Reviewed 65 of 65 files at r1. Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 13 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed. --- *[sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/values/BeamRecordType.java, line 42 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4488#-L3j4QKSY46JU2MvnQqc:-L3j4QKSY46JU2MvnQqd:bkb08xk) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/b96407aa84967a71caef6e88db35c603b7f0557c/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/values/BeamRecordType.java#L42)):* > ```Java > * Create a {@link BeamRecordType} with a name and Coder for each field. > */ > public BeamRecordType(List fieldNames, List fieldCoders) { > ``` Two things that would be more readable and impossible to get wrong: Having a `Field` POJO or accepting a `Map`. --- *[sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/values/BeamRecordType.java, line 70 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4488#-L3j5BT-8fuATwVzoMMP:-L3j5BT-8fuATwVzoMMQ:bvltkrs) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/b96407aa84967a71caef6e88db35c603b7f0557c/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/values/BeamRecordType.java#L70)):* > ```Java > * Return the field coder for {@code index}. > */ > public Coder getFieldCoder(int index){ > ``` So if I want the coder for a named field I first find the index and then look it up here? I guess I see that mostly by-name access is not important since it didn't really exist before. --- *[sdks/java/extensions/sql/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/extensions/sql/BeamRecordSqlType.java, line 53 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4488#-L3j5YFL5tNbIxOsu9yI:-L3j5YFL5tNbIxOsu9yJ:bkoz77q) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/f7dd0505efe88a28f020ffc88c993589f48b3f98/sdks/java/extensions/sql/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/extensions/sql/BeamRecordSqlType.java#L53)):* > ```Java > * > */ > public class BeamRecordSqlType extends BeamRecordType { > ``` So basically this now is just a fancy builder for SQL-friendly `BeamRecordType`. That makes sense to me. I definitely like eliminating inheritance between them, and mostly deleting this class where I can't really tell the use of it. Maybe we can eventually trim even more. --- *[sdks/java/extensions/sql/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/extensions/sql/BeamSqlRecordHelper.java, line 45 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4488#-L3j6N7QySj72uk7bQr3:-L3j6N7QySj72uk7bQr4:bvionxo) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/b96407aa84967a71caef6e88db35c603b7f0557c/sdks/java/extensions/sql/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/extensions/sql/BeamSqlRecordHelper.java#L45)):* > ```Java > * {@link Coder} for Java type {@link Short}. > */ > public static class ShortCoder extends AtomicCoder { > ``` Yes to this: these are all `AtomicCoder`. Separately, it seems like we should just map SQL types to existing Beam coders unless we know these are a big win. Mostly, I expect they are not, reading their code. Since encoding/decoding can dominate a CPU-bound pipeline and shuffle costs are also important, we should measure this. --- *[sdks/java/extensions/sql/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/extensions/sql/SqlTypeCoder.java, line 49 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4488#-L3j7MTEmlcRb30WoZWk:-L3j7MTEmlcRb30WoZWl:b-k4rq3w) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/b96407aa84967a71caef6e88db35c603b7f0557c/sdks/java/extensions/sql/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/extensions/sql/SqlTypeCoder.java#L49)):* > ```Java > *

Relies on URN for equality and hashcode. > */ > public class SqlTypeCoder extends CustomCoder

Review status: 0 of 77 files reviewed at latest revision, 4 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed. --- *[runners/samza/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/samza/SamzaPipelineOptions.java, line 46 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4340#-L2QxfBrdvudRv-Bm-BX:-L3jB6bFY8P--BVKWi2u:b-65vaba) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/8b6500ab69a4b159629d07c6d2fa79c4a3fd002d/runners/samza/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/samza/SamzaPipelineOptions.java#L46)):*
Previously, xinyuiscool wrote
@rangadi you're right about maxSourceParallism, which is used to set the "desiredNumSplits" so the splits are bounded by this number. In samza, this will decide the number of tasks for a job. What I was saying (I think Kenneth meant the same) is that it'll be super nice that BEAM provides an API for the source to split into a default number, like the number of partitions in Kafka. So as a user, he doesn't need to bother finding out the number of each input kafka topic parittions when he runs the job. For LinkedIn, this is very valuable since a Kafka topic might have different partitions in different fabrics, so a default will be very helpful to the users. That's also the behavior in Samza today if the user doesn't provide a customized grouper of partitions: each partition becomes a task (or a split in this case).
Thanks. I am not sure if I you would like me to address any specific question. Please let me know. If the purpose is to let the user set number of tasks for a job, may be the option could be named '(max)NumberOfTasks'. I am just thinking aloud with little overall context. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4340)*

> One question about the behavior of method finalizeCheckpoint(), in the case of no-checkpoint is enabled for a job, will this function be called?

I think it is always called by the runner. We set 'reader' only if commits are enabled.
Test failures are unrelated.

Converted to subclasses of `CustomCoder` for now, removed URN. Does this look better? --- Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 13 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed. --- *[sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/values/BeamRecordType.java, line 42 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4488#-L3j4QKSY46JU2MvnQqc:-L3jdZwiCZrrEp3Q_UzE:bl9qaza) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/b96407aa84967a71caef6e88db35c603b7f0557c/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/values/BeamRecordType.java#L42)):*
Previously, kennknowles (Kenn Knowles) wrote
Two things that would be more readable and impossible to get wrong: Having a `Field` POJO or accepting a `Map`.
Yeah, I have a commit for `Field` and factory methods on `BeamRecordType` but I think I better send it in a separate PR on top of this one --- *[sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/values/BeamRecordType.java, line 70 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4488#-L3j5BT-8fuATwVzoMMP:-L3jdtDO2SpEebq3h8Th:b-k4mrot) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/b96407aa84967a71caef6e88db35c603b7f0557c/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/values/BeamRecordType.java#L70)):*
Previously, kennknowles (Kenn Knowles) wrote
So if I want the coder for a named field I first find the index and then look it up here? I guess I see that mostly by-name access is not important since it didn't really exist before.
I was thinking to add `getCoderByName()` but not sure how useful it is. No code needs it at the moment, we already have the index in all places where we access the field coder. --- *[sdks/java/extensions/sql/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/extensions/sql/BeamRecordSqlType.java, line 53 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4488#-L3j5YFL5tNbIxOsu9yI:-L3jeBDfUn3DhRO0BXzd:btqck9g) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/f7dd0505efe88a28f020ffc88c993589f48b3f98/sdks/java/extensions/sql/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/extensions/sql/BeamRecordSqlType.java#L53)):*
Previously, kennknowles (Kenn Knowles) wrote
So basically this now is just a fancy builder for SQL-friendly `BeamRecordType`. That makes sense to me. I definitely like eliminating inheritance between them, and mostly deleting this class where I can't really tell the use of it. Maybe we can eventually trim even more.
Yup, just kept the builder for now. --- *[sdks/java/extensions/sql/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/extensions/sql/BeamSqlRecordHelper.java, line 45 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4488#-L3j6N7QySj72uk7bQr3:-L3jeJFejxoCcQfKtvoV:b-az6jff) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/b96407aa84967a71caef6e88db35c603b7f0557c/sdks/java/extensions/sql/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/extensions/sql/BeamSqlRecordHelper.java#L45)):*
Previously, kennknowles (Kenn Knowles) wrote
Yes to this: these are all `AtomicCoder`. Separately, it seems like we should just map SQL types to existing Beam coders unless we know these are a big win. Mostly, I expect they are not, reading their code. Since encoding/decoding can dominate a CPU-bound pipeline and shuffle costs are also important, we should measure this.
As discussed, at the moment we need stable 2-way mapping, so using existing types may not work. Added custom subtypes of `CustomCoder` instead --- *[sdks/java/extensions/sql/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/extensions/sql/SqlTypeCoder.java, line 49 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4488#-L3j7MTEmlcRb30WoZWk:-L3k30COdY3NhB-PlCLl:bqgikho) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/b96407aa84967a71caef6e88db35c603b7f0557c/sdks/java/extensions/sql/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/extensions/sql/SqlTypeCoder.java#L49)):*
Previously, kennknowles (Kenn Knowles) wrote
A `CustomCoder` is really a shorthand/shortcut for users, to mean "A coder that only the Java SDK understands and is serialized via Java serialization". I had thought there was a registry from coder class to translator. I think we need such a thing. So coders are unchanged and the URN would like in the `CoderTranslator`. Basically a registry with a `Map, CoderTranslator>` to see how to turn a coder into a proto and then a `Map` to know how to turn it back into a Java coder. @tgroh didn't you do something along these lines?
After talking to @tgroh it appears we currently don't have the ability to register coders. Converted this code to subclassing the `CustomCoder`. Previously, kennknowles (Kenn Knowles) wrote
I see how your change causes the need for these downcasts. I think it is still good, though. What we should really be doing is converting from a `BeamRecordType` to some kind of schema all up front at once and giving good error messages.
I don't believe we actually need to map back to Calcite type at all. For example,`BeamSqlExpression`'s output type currently is Calcite's `SqlTypeName`. So whenever we need to extract results from expression or create a new expression, we need to map between existing `BeamRecordType`'s fields and expression return type. Even without schema, by just updating low level things like output types to the coders should remove the need of reverse mapping. I haven't explored yet how extensive this change would be. --- *[sdks/java/extensions/sql/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/extensions/sql/meta/provider/text/BeamTextCSVTableIOWriter.java, line 44 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4488#-L3jA9TeNrZbBQfFSvug:-L3k7r4JRLyAzhvnQG6R:bb7f2mf) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/b96407aa84967a71caef6e88db35c603b7f0557c/sdks/java/extensions/sql/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/extensions/sql/meta/provider/text/BeamTextCSVTableIOWriter.java#L44)):*

It's possible to mimic what the release plugin is doing using:

```
mvn clean install -Prelease
```

Then you can check the resulting source zip file in the target folder.

Any updates here? It does look like the rebase was not quite right, as a good chunk of `apache:master` appears to have been rebased as well. You might explicitly rebase like so:

  `git rebase -i HEAD~2 origin/master`

Where I have chosen `HEAD~2` since it looks like you have two commits, and `-i` because you might as well squash them together at this point.
